ANALYSIS.NAME: Process Private Bytes

THRESHOLD.NAME: Increasing trend of more than 100 MB per hour - may not be accurate on counter logs of less than 1 hour
More than 1 GB of system committed memory usage

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
This analysis determines if one or more processes are leaking private, committed, memory over time. A process consuming large portions of memory is okay as long as the process returns the memory back to the system. Look for increasing trends in the chart. An increasing trend over a long period of time could indicate a system committed memory leak. Private Bytes is the current size, in bytes, of memory that this process has allocated that cannot be shared with other processes. This analysis checks for a 100 MB per hour increasing trend. Use this analysis in correlation with the \Memory\Committed Bytes performance counter.

Use this analysis in correlation with the \Memory\Committed Bytes. If you suspect a memory leak condition, then install and use the Debug Diag tool. For more information on the Debug Diag Tool, see the references section.

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: ID Process is the unique identifier of this process. ID Process numbers are reused, so they only identify a process for the lifetime of that process.
